name: sample_document
description: Sample blueprint demonstrating all possible fields and features

inputs.label: Document Title
inputs.description: A clear, concise title for your document

inputs.label: Document Type
inputs.description: Select the type of document you're creating

inputs.label: Executive Summary
inputs.description: Brief overview of the document (3-5 sentences)

inputs.label: Does this have a budget component?
inputs.description: Check if this document includes budget information

inputs.label: Target Audience
inputs.description: Who is this document for? (select all that apply)

inputs.label: Contact Email
inputs.description: Email address for questions or feedback

sections.title: Background
sections.prompt_template: Synthesize background information from: {executive_summary} and current context. Focus on why this document is needed now.

sections.title: Recommendations
sections.prompt_template: Based on the analysis, provide 3-5 actionable recommendations. Each should include: what to do, why it matters, and expected outcomes.

restate_problem.prompt: Based on the user's executive summary and context, restate the core purpose of this document in 2-3 sentences. What problem does it address or what decision does it inform?
restate_problem.expected_output: A concise problem or purpose statement

identify_gaps.prompt: Review the provided inputs and identify any critical information gaps. What details are missing that would make this document more effective? List 3-5 specific gaps.
identify_gaps.expected_output: A numbered list of information gaps with brief explanations

clarifying_questions.prompt: Generate clarifying questions to improve document quality. Focus on areas where more detail would be valuable.

confirm_scope.prompt: Based on the inputs provided, clearly state what IS included in this document's scope and what is NOT included. Use bullet points.
confirm_scope.expected_output: Two lists: 'In Scope' (3-5 items) and 'Out of Scope' (3-5 items)

verification_questions.question: Does the document clearly state its purpose in the overview?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Revise the Overview section to explicitly state the document's purpose within the first paragraph.

verification_questions.question: Are all key findings supported by evidence or analysis?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Review each finding and ensure it references specific data, research, or analysis. Add citations where appropriate.

verification_questions.question: Do the recommendations logically follow from the analysis?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Ensure each recommendation clearly connects to a finding or insight from the analysis section. Add explicit linkage if missing.

verification_questions.question: Is the document appropriate for the target audience(s)?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Review technical depth, language complexity, and level of detail. Adjust to match audience expertise and needs.

verification_questions.question: Are all required sections present and complete?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Check the blueprint for required sections. Add any missing sections with appropriate content.

verification_questions.question: If budget is included, are costs justified and realistic?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Provide clear justification for budget items. Include market research or comparable projects to support cost estimates.

verification_questions.question: Is the writing clear, concise, and professional?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Review for passive voice, jargon, redundancy, and unclear phrasing. Use active voice and concrete language.

verification_questions.question: Does the conclusion effectively summarize key points?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Revise conclusion to briefly restate the problem, summarize key findings, and reinforce top recommendations.

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: Clear, concise, and professional writing throughout

excellent.description: Crystal clear writing with no ambiguity. Perfect readability for target audience.

good.description: Mostly clear with occasional minor ambiguities. Easy to understand.

adequate.description: Understandable but sometimes verbose or unclear. Requires some re-reading.

needs_improvement.description: Multiple unclear or confusing sections. Difficult to follow in places.

poor.description: Very difficult to understand. Pervasive clarity issues throughout.

criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: All required sections present with sufficient depth and detail

excellent.description: All sections complete, well-developed, and appropriately detailed.

good.description: All sections present with minor gaps in detail or depth.

adequate.description: Most sections complete but some lack sufficient detail.

needs_improvement.description: Several sections incomplete or superficial. Key information missing.

poor.description: Major sections missing or severely underdeveloped.

criteria.name: Logical Flow
criteria.description: Arguments and sections flow logically with clear connections

excellent.description: Perfect logical progression. Each section builds naturally on previous ones.

good.description: Good flow with minor disconnects or jumps in logic.

adequate.description: Generally logical but some sections feel disconnected.

needs_improvement.description: Multiple logical gaps or unclear connections between ideas.

poor.description: Disjointed with no clear logical structure.

criteria.name: Evidence & Support
criteria.description: Claims and recommendations backed by solid evidence

excellent.description: All claims thoroughly supported with credible evidence, data, or analysis.

good.description: Most claims supported. Minor gaps in evidence or citations.

adequate.description: Some claims supported but significant gaps in evidence.

needs_improvement.description: Many unsupported claims. Limited use of evidence.

poor.description: Almost no supporting evidence. Mostly opinion or assertion.
